Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including scalability, performance, and security needs. Identify the programming language and framework to be used.
Design the architecture for the web application, including the use of App Service Plans, deployment slots, and integration with other Azure services.
Provision an App Service Plan based on the required performance tier (e.g., Free, Shared, Basic, Standard, Premium). Ensure the plan supports the expected workload.
Deploy the web application to Azure App Service using deployment methods such as Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or manual deployment via FTP or Azure CLI.
Set up application settings, including environment variables, connection strings, and app-specific configurations in the Azure portal.
Enable HTTPS, configure custom domains with SSL certificates, and set up authentication and authorization mechanisms for the web application.
Configure backup and restore settings for the web application to ensure data resiliency and recovery options.
Configure monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Application Insights to track application performance and detect issues.
Perform thorough testing of the web application, including load testing, security testing, and failover scenarios to ensure reliability and performance.
Implement performance optimization techniques such as scaling, caching, and CDN integration to improve application responsiveness.
Create detailed documentation for the web application setup, including architecture diagrams, configuration settings, and operational procedures.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the web application hosted on Azure App Service.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security and performance standards. Verify that the application meets organizational and regulatory requirements.
